page.title: 07Stanwell_Local History
page.content:
thought to be as old as King Stephen's reign.
{Lord Knyvett's}tomb,erected in 1622, stands in the chancel of the church, and has a life size statue of him and his wife Elizabeth, in a kneeling position accompanied by a latin inscription. For this work the sculptuor Nicholas Stone was paid a large sum of Â£215. It has survived the course of nearly three hundred years and is still in good condition.
{Lord Knyvett's School}was opened 357 years ago. Lord Knyvett the founder of the school was the London magistrate who arrested {Guy Fawkes}in the cellars of the houses of parliament and frustrated the famous {Gun Powder Plot }. Lord Knyvett said in his will that a
